alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 1:03PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Twiggs, Jones, Monroe and Bibb Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Macon...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 26 feet, Moderate flooding begins on the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge with some areas under 6 feet of water. Backyards of a few homes on the left bank near Glenridge Drive will be flooded. Portions of the Southern Railroad tracks around Mead Road will become inundated. Large portions of agricultural lands just east and south of Macon will be under 1 to 8 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 24.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
